title: Tiffany Wu
text:
Welcome!
I am on the 2025-2026 job market and available for interviews.
I am a doctoral student in the Combined Program in Education and Psychology (CPEP) at the University of Michigan and am pursuing a dual master’s degree in Statistics. I am also an IES Causal Inference Predoctoral Fellow.
At the University of Michigan, I work with Dr. Christina Weiland. I am interested in using machine learning, computational social science, causal inference, and psychometric methods to help inform the development of effective education tools, interventions, and policies. I am also interested in collaborating as part of research-practice partnerships to make research more publicly accessible and able to guide real-world decision-making. My research is deeply influenced by my previous work as a public high school teacher in Chicago and then as a research analyst for an education non-profit prior to starting my PhD. In my free time, I like to paint, play the piano, and play pickleball.


PhD in Education & Psychology | University of Michigan | Expected 2026
MA in Statistics | University of Michigan | Expected 2026
MA in Psychology | University of Chicago | 2019
BS in Secondary Education & History | Northwestern University | 2015
